titleInfo.title: Longwell v. Omaha Performing Arts Society
titleInfo.subTitle: SECOND AMENDED ORDER SETTING FINAL SCHEDULE FOR PROGRESSION OF CASE. Joint oral motion 35 granted. Deposition deadline 7/19/2009. Final pretrial conference set for 1/18/2010 at 10:00 a.m., in chambers before Magistrate Judge F. A. Gossett. Jury trial set for 2/16/2010 in Courtroom 2 before the Honorable Laurie Smith Camp. (ARL,) Modified on 5/11/2009 to correct entry (ARL,).

titleInfo.title: Longwell v. Omaha Performing Arts Society
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER that the Plaintiff's Motion to Extend Time 46 is granted and the Plaintiff's brief in response to the Defendant's Motion for SummaryJudgment 41 and any corresponding index of evidence shall be filed on or before August 28, 2009. Ordered by Judge Laurie Smith Camp. (CJP)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 8:07-cv-00489; Longwell v. Omaha Performing Arts Society;
extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER that the Plaintiff's Motion to Extend Time 46 is granted and the Plaintiff's brief in response to the Defendant's Motion for SummaryJudgment 41 and any corresponding index of evidence shall be filed on or before August 28, 2009. Ordered by Judge Laurie Smith Camp. (CJP)

titleInfo.title: Longwell v. Omaha Performing Arts Society
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER that Plaintiff David Longwell's Motion to Strike/Objection to Certain Evidence submitted by Defendant 49 is granted; Defendant Omaha Performing Arts Society's exhibits found at Filing Nos.43-15 and 43-16 are deemed stricken for the purposes of the pending motion for summary judgment and have been given no weight or consideration bythe Court; Defendant Omaha Performing Arts Society's Objections to Plaintiff'sEvidence Submitted in Opposition to Motion for Summary Judgment 54 are denied; and Defendant Omaha Performing Arts Society's Motion for Summary Judgment 41 is granted in part, as follows: Plaintiff David Longwell's failure-to-hire claim is dismissed; and the Motion for Summary Judgment is otherwise denied. Ordered by Judge Laurie Smith Camp. (CJP)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 8:07-cv-00489; Longwell v. Omaha Performing Arts Society;
extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER that Plaintiff David Longwell's Motion to Strike/Objection to Certain Evidence submitted by Defendant 49 is granted; Defendant Omaha Performing Arts Society's exhibits found at Filing Nos.43-15 and 43-16 are deemed stricken for the purposes of the pending motion for summary judgment and have been given no weight or consideration bythe Court; Defendant Omaha Performing Arts Society's Objections to Plaintiff'sEvidence Submitted in Opposition to Motion for Summary Judgment 54 are denied; and Defendant Omaha Performing Arts Society's Motion for Summary Judgment 41 is granted in part, as follows: Plaintiff David Longwell's failure-to-hire claim is dismissed; and the Motion for Summary Judgment is otherwise denied. Ordered by Judge Laurie Smith Camp. (CJP)

titleInfo.title: Longwell v. Omaha Performing Arts Society
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER - On or before February 12, 2010, the parties shall electronically file a joint stipulation for dismissal (or other dispositive stipulation) and shall submit to District Judge Laurie Smith Camp, at smithcamp@ned.uscourts.gov, a draft order which will fully dispose of the case. Absent compliance with this order, this case (including all counterclaims and the like) may be dismissed without further notice. The final pretrial conference set for January 15, 2010, is cancelled upon the representation that this case is settled.Ordered by Magistrate Judge F. A. Gossett. (TCL)

titleInfo.title: Longwell v. Omaha Performing Arts Society
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER approving 60 Joint Stipulation for Dismissal with Prejudice. Plaintiff David Longwell's claims against Defendant Omaha Performing Arts Society are dismissed with prejudice. Each party will pay its own costs and attorney fees. Ordered by Judge Laurie Smith Camp. (JAE)
